MoonSharp.​VsCodeDebugger.​MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer
IDisposable
public
MoonSharp.​VsCodeDebugger.​MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer

Class implementing a debugger allowing attaching from a Visual Studio Code debugging session.

Variables
m_Lock
object m_Lock
m_DebuggerList
List<AsyncDebugger> m_DebuggerList
m_Current
AsyncDebugger m_Current
m_StopEvent
ManualResetEvent m_StopEvent
m_Started
bool m_Started
m_Port
int m_Port
Functions
MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer
public MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer(
int port =  41912
)

Initializes a new instance of the MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer class.

Parameter
port
int

The port on which the debugger listens. It's recommended to use 41912.

MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer
[Obsolete("Use the constructor taking only a port, and the 'Attach' method instead.")]
public MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer(
Script script,
int port,
Func<SourceCode, string> sourceFinder =  null
)

Initializes a new instance of the MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer class with a default script.  Note that for this specific script, it will NOT attach the debugger to the script.

Parameters
script
Script

The script object to debug.

port
int

The port on which the debugger listens. It's recommended to use 41912 unless you are going to keep more than one script object around.

sourceFinder
Func<SourceCode, string>

A function which gets in input a source code and returns the path to source file to use. It can return null and in that case (or if the file cannot be found) a temporary file will be generated on the fly.

AttachToScript
public void AttachToScript(
Script script,
string name,
Func<SourceCode, string> sourceFinder =  null
)

Attaches the specified script to the debugger

Parameters
script
Script

The script.

name
string

The name of the script.

sourceFinder
Func<SourceCode, string>

A function which gets in input a source code and returns the path to source file to use. It can return null and in that case (or if the file cannot be found) a temporary file will be generated on the fly.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

If the script has already been attached to this debugger.

GetAttachedDebuggersByIdAndName
public IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<int, string>> GetAttachedDebuggersByIdAndName()

Gets a list of the attached debuggers by id and name

Properties
CurrentId
public int? CurrentId { get; set }

Gets or sets the current script by ID (see GetAttachedDebuggersByIdAndName).  New vscode connections will attach to this debugger ID. Changing the current ID does NOT disconnect connected clients.

Current
public Script Current { get; set }

Gets or sets the current script. New vscode connections will attach to this script. Changing the current script does NOT disconnect connected clients.

Functions
Detach
public void Detach(
Script script
)

Detaches the specified script. The debugger attached to that script will get disconnected.

Parameter
script
Script

The script.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

Thrown if the script cannot be found.

Properties
Logger
public Action<string> Logger { get; set }

Gets or sets a delegate which will be called when logging messages are generated

Functions
GetDebugger
[Obsolete("Use the Attach method instead.")]
public IDebugger GetDebugger()

Gets the debugger object. Obsolete, use the new interface using the Attach method instead.

Dispose
public void Dispose()

Stops listening

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

Cannot stop; server was not started.

Start
public MoonSharpVsCodeDebugServer Start()

Starts listening on the localhost for incoming connections.
